item.title: What is LRU Cache And How It Works ?
item.description: What is LRU cache A cache is a way to store data that accessed frequently and needs to be fast. We can use cache to store a result from computation or result of SQL query. A cache is usually stored in memory with a key-value style to make sure it fast to store item and access. One of the cache algorithms is LRU or Least Recently Used. LRU will limit the memory usage by gives maximum items that can be stored.
